post.description:
Create a platform rule for a given site.

Platform rules define a list of event sources that will trigger a list of actions, in case a list of conditions
are met.

The user creating a platform rule must have at least super manager role on the given site.

enabled.description: Determines whether the platform rule is enabled.

sources.description: A set of sources of a platform rule event.

type.description:
Type of the source event.

* `no_visitor_message` - The visitor didn't send a message in the last `threshold` seconds.

threshold.description: The number of seconds the visitor has not sent any messages. Must be in the range of 10 to 43200.

type.description:
Type of the source event.

* `reactive_request_pending` - A reactive engagement, transfer or
join request has been pending for a number of seconds.

threshold.description: Number of seconds that defines for how long the request has been pending for the platform rule to trigger. Must be in the range of 0 to 60.

conditions.description: A set of conditions that regulates the triggering of the platform rule.

type.description: Either the visitor’s highest media type (in case source event `no_visitor_message`) or requested media type (in case of source event `reactive_request_pending`) is one of the media types listed in `media_type` array.

media_type.description: Media types associated with the condition.

type.description: Either the engagement leg (in case source event `no_visitor_message`) or reactive request (in case of source event `reactive_request_pending`) is from a queue listed in `queue_ids` array.

queue_ids.description: The queue IDs associated with the condition.

actions.description: A set of actions that are triggered when the platform rule's conditions are met and the source events occur.

type.description:
End the current engagement.

This action is valid in context of the following sources: `no_visitor_message`.

Send chat message to the recipient.

This action is valid in context of the following sources: `no_visitor_message`.

message.description:
A message to the recipient.

* `message` can either be a string or an object containing additional properties.

oneOf.title: Text message
oneOf.description: A textual message that sender wishes to send to the recipient.
oneOf.example: Is there anything I can help you with?

content.description: A textual part of the message that the sender wishes to send to the recipient.
content.example: Is there anything I can help you with?

type.description: Chat message type.

Type of an attachment.

To present the user with the list of options to make a simplified decision for the next interaction, type must
be `single_choice`. Selected option will be sent back to the other party as a regular chat message containing
single choice response attachment.

options.description: A list of all available choices for the user to choose from.

text.description: Text displayed to user as a choice label.

value.description: Value of the choice sent as a response on user interaction.

image_url.description: URL of an image displayed on top of the choices expressing clear intent of the cards.

metadata.description:
Chat message metadata allows an integrator to add end to end
data inside a JSON object.

This information is only relevant
to the integrator and will be handled transparently inside
Glia.

Chat message metadata is an optional property of type JSON
object specified by the integrator. Any JSON object is
allowed.
